page.title: 08Attitudes in Pennington.
page.content: Fears:In our survey we found that most people feared nuclear war.Many others feared the increasing violence in society today.Another worry was of mass starvation as a result of crop faliures and the growing population.Lots of people were frightened of disease,especially new ones such sa AIDS. Some people thought that too many people took drugs which was a bad thing.Hopes:Most people hoped that the world would become more peaceful,that there would be more jobs for the young and that cures would be found for more diseases.People hoped that life would be easier for their children and that they could have nice houses and jobs.When we asked,people answered that if they wone a lot of money they would improve their houses and invest money in the bank.
